hint: A plan for managing income and expenses.
The action of putting money into financial schemes, shares, or property with the expectation of achieving a profit.
The cost of borrowing money, usually expressed as a percentage.
A sum of money paid regularly by a company to its shareholders out of its profits.
A loan used to purchase real estate, typically repaid with interest over a set period.
The value of the shares issued by a company, or the value of an owner's interest in a property, after deducting liabilities.
